medical_history.chief_complaint: Depression following an acute non-Q-wave myocardial infarction.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reported feeling 'very bored' and restless after discharge, which started almost every day post-hospital discharge. He noted past experiences of low mood around holidays but stated these feelings became more constant. He frequently cried and felt very unhappy, reflecting on his life experiences as failures. No change in appetite, weight, or sleep habits was reported.
medical_history.social_history: The patient worked long hours as a steel cutter, described as 'bull work' causing constant strain. He acknowledged being stubborn and described a significant amount of social contact with family and friends. However, he spent most of his days at home post-discharge.
